reinforcements.similarity: Four layers independently converge on the same principle: the first 2 seconds of every phase transition must pass System 1's automatic trust assessment through familiar anchors before demanding System 2 engagement.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: works-001 defines the process pattern (System 1 trust gate at every transition). communicates-001 specifies the information hierarchy (anchor-then-advance: host's own data first). looks-001 specifies the visual implementation (warm surface continuity, warm off-white backgrounds). feels-001 specifies the emotional target (cognitive ease as the foundation of trust). All four cite the same evidence: andreas-call.txt 0:09-0:50 (Andreas's calm, open tone indicating System 1 had already approved), and Kahneman's associative coherence principle. The convergence is 4 layers deep with zero contradiction.
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONG REINFORCEMENT. This is the single most validated principle in the entire run. Promote to a core design principle in the element library with maximum confidence. All four element IDs should be linked as a coherence cluster.

reinforcements.new_element_id: works-004 + communicates-006 + looks-004 + behaves-006 + feels-005 + feels-008
reinforcements.similarity: Six elements across five layers converge on the human-to-digital trust bridge: the agent (Bryant) must be the persistent identity on the platform, not the brand. Trust was built with a person and must transfer through that person.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: works-004 defines the process (continuity priming from human to digital). communicates-006 specifies the information pattern (agent-attributed messages). looks-004 specifies the visual treatment (agent photo and name as persistent trust element). behaves-006 specifies the notification behavior (attributed to agent, through preferred channel). feels-005 specifies the emotional register (every touchpoint must rhyme with the call). feels-008 specifies the safety net (host always one tap from a real person). All cite andreas-call.txt 5:27-6:11 (personal promises, no platform mention) and Kahneman's priming research. Six-layer convergence with zero contradiction.
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONGEST REINFORCEMENT. The most deeply validated cluster. This is the architectural spine of the design. Any implementation that breaks agent continuity contradicts 6 elements across 5 layers.

reinforcements.similarity: Five elements converge on designing for the depleted user: smart defaults, single-sum financial display, depletion-aware pacing, and invisible accommodation of cognitive limits.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: works-002 defines the process (design for the depleted user at every step after the first). communicates-002 specifies information hierarchy (one total before any breakdown). looks-003 specifies visual treatment (single-number financial focal point at 28px IBM Plex Mono). feels-004 specifies the emotional pacing (stroll, not sprint, with decompression moments). feels-007 specifies the dignity constraint (invisible accommodation, no patronizing). All cite Kahneman's ego depletion research and the parole judge study. Five-layer convergence.
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONG REINFORCEMENT. The depletion-awareness principle is validated across process, information, visual, and emotional layers. Smart defaults and single-sum financials are high-confidence design decisions.

reinforcements.similarity: Four elements converge on the advisor moment: the host must shift from data provider to expertise contributor at a carefully chosen point in each eligible phase.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: works-005 defines the process pattern (engineer the host-as-advisor moment). communicates-007 specifies the information architecture (validation statement, then question, then open response). behaves-005 specifies the interaction pattern (visual mode shift, timing, states). feels-003 specifies the emotional target (the advisor glow, confidence through recognized expertise). All cite andreas-call.txt 5:12-5:27 (unprompted furnishing advice) and the validation trigger at 4:06-4:26. Four-layer convergence.
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONG REINFORCEMENT. The advisor moment is validated as both a process mechanism and an emotional target. Implementation should prioritize the validation-before-question sequence, which all four layers emphasize.

reinforcements.similarity: Three elements converge on mental model translation: the platform must accept input in the host's native format (monthly rent, natural language descriptions) and translate internally.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: works-006 defines the process (translate between host's mental model and platform's data model). communicates-002 specifies the financial translation (single sum in host's format first, platform format as secondary annotation). communicates-004 specifies the description translation (7-second conversational density, quick-select chips over dropdowns). All cite andreas-call.txt 3:02-3:16 (monthly pricing mental model) and 1:03-1:10 (7-second unit description).
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONG REINFORCEMENT. The translation principle is consistent across process and information layers. The platform must never force the host to convert between formats.

reinforcements.similarity: Three elements converge on matching the platform's cognitive speed to the phone call's conversational speed: sequential, one topic at a time, with immediate feedback.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: works-003 defines the process (match conversational speed). communicates-004 specifies information density (7-second unit description, 5 fields in a single view). behaves-002 specifies the interaction (sequential disclosure, one cluster at a time). All cite the same evidence: andreas-call.txt 1:03-1:10 (7-second unit description) and Kahneman's System 2 natural speed concept.
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONG REINFORCEMENT. Speed-matching is validated across process, information, and interaction layers. The 30-60 second per-step time budget from works-002 is a testable constraint.

reinforcements.similarity: Three elements converge on the trust credential presentation: mechanism before promise, using green badges, producing the emotion of relief.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: communicates-003 defines the information hierarchy (process before promise, verification before claim). looks-005 defines the visual treatment (accent green reserved exclusively for verified elements). feels-002 defines the emotional arc (show the money, then show why it is safe). All cite andreas-call.txt 3:28-3:51 (Bryant's trust chain: credit check -> pre-authorization -> guarantee) and Kahneman's associative coherence.
reinforcements.recommendation: STRONG REINFORCEMENT. The trust credential pattern is validated across information, visual, and emotional layers. The green color reservation is a critical design constraint.

reinforcements.similarity: Two elements converge on the pre-packaged proposal pattern: proposals are confirmations, not constructions. One-tap acceptance as the default path.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: communicates-005 defines the information architecture (tenant narrative first, matched terms second, single confirm action third). behaves-003 defines the interaction pattern (full-width accept button, inline adjustment as secondary path, no blank counter-offer forms). Both cite andreas-call.txt 1:58-2:19 (Bryant presents Ariel and Amber as a complete package) and Kahneman's System 1 endorsement mechanism.
reinforcements.recommendation: REINFORCEMENT. Two-layer convergence. The one-tap acceptance principle is well-validated.

contradictions.existing_element_id: looks-005 own rule vs. looks-007 (motion as confirmation)
contradictions.conflict: looks-005 states: 'green appears only on trust badges, agent photo borders, and primary action buttons (confirm/accept).' This includes primary action buttons. However, looks-007 describes the accept button using accent green, and behaves-003 specifies a 'full-width button in accent green (#2d5a3d)' for proposal acceptance. The tension is: if green is reserved for 'verified/trust' signals AND used for primary action buttons, the semantic exclusivity of green (green = verified) is diluted. A 'confirm' button is an action, not a verification. The host's learned association (green = something has been checked) would be confused by green also meaning 'click here to do something.'
contradictions.evidence_comparison: looks-005 evidence argues green should mean 'verified' exclusively. behaves-003 evidence argues the accept button should be green because acceptance advances toward a verified outcome. The two are reconcilable but the current specification is ambiguous about whether action buttons are in-scope for the green reservation.
contradictions.recommendation: CLARIFY. Define two distinct green treatments: (1) green badges (accent-light background + accent text, pill shape) for verification status, and (2) green filled buttons (accent background + white text, button shape) for commitment actions. The form factor (pill vs. button) preserves semantic distinction even though the color is shared. Alternatively, restrict green to badges only and use ink (#1a1714) for primary action buttons.

contradictions.conflict: behaves-002 prescribes one-at-a-time sequential disclosure: 'each cluster is revealed only after the prior cluster is completed.' communicates-004 prescribes conversational density: 'the first screen of listing creation captures the 5 essential data points in a single view, not spread across multiple steps.' These are in tension: should the unit snapshot be one dense screen (communicates-004) or sequentially disclosed clusters (behaves-002)?
contradictions.evidence_comparison: communicates-004 is grounded in the 7-second call evidence: Andreas conveyed 5 data points simultaneously in conversation. behaves-002 is grounded in the ego depletion evidence: sequential disclosure prevents meta-decision fatigue. The two principles serve different cognitive goals: density serves speed (matching the call), sequence serves depletion (protecting cognitive resources). The resolution depends on which phase of the journey: early data entry (unit snapshot) benefits from density; later decision-heavy steps (pricing, rules) benefit from sequence.
contradictions.recommendation: RESOLVE by scoping. Apply communicates-004 density to the unit snapshot (Step 1: all core fields visible at once). Apply behaves-002 sequential disclosure to decision-heavy steps (Steps 3-6: one cluster at a time). The unit snapshot is recognition-heavy (the host knows this data cold) and benefits from density. Later steps are decision-heavy (unfamiliar choices) and benefit from sequence. This hybrid approach honors both principles.

contradictions.conflict: feels-007 states: 'Pre-filled fields do not say We filled this in for you -- they say Based on similar listings.' feels-004 states: 'Frame remaining work as easy and pre-filled: Just a quick review of rules -- we suggested defaults based on similar listings.' The tension: feels-007 says do NOT highlight that defaults are pre-filled, while feels-004 says DO frame remaining work as pre-filled to create momentum. These two instructions can produce contradictory copy on the same screen.
contradictions.evidence_comparison: feels-007 is concerned with dignity (the host should not feel their judgment is being bypassed). feels-004 is concerned with momentum (the host should feel the remaining work is easy). Both are valid emotional targets. The resolution is a matter of framing: the host can be told 'this step is mostly done' (momentum signal) without being told 'we did it for you' (dignity violation).
contradictions.recommendation: RESOLVE by tone calibration. Use language that attributes defaults to external research ('Based on similar Washington Heights listings') rather than to the platform's action ('We pre-filled these for you'). The host hears 'the data speaks' (confidence-preserving) not 'we decided for you' (dignity-threatening). This satisfies both feels-004 (the remaining work feels easy because defaults exist) and feels-007 (the host feels they are confirming research, not accepting the platform's judgment).

extensions.gap_filled: System 1 trust gating at phase transitions. No prior element addressed the automatic assessment that determines whether a host even begins to evaluate a new screen.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Grounded in both call evidence (Andreas's pre-approved trust state) and Kahneman's core framework (System 1 generates impressions before System 2 evaluates). 4-layer internal reinforcement.

extensions.gap_filled: Ego depletion across multi-step processes. No prior element addressed the progressive degradation of decision quality across the host journey.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Directly supported by Kahneman's parole judge research and observable in the call's energy decline from 0:09 to 6:11. 5-layer internal reinforcement.

extensions.gap_filled: Speed matching between conversational and platform interactions. No prior element quantified the cognitive speed gap between phone calls and forms.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. The 7-second unit description benchmark (andreas-call.txt 1:03-1:10) provides a concrete, measurable target. 3-layer internal reinforcement.

extensions.gap_filled: Human-to-digital trust transfer. No prior element addressed the highest-risk transition in the journey: from Bryant's phone call to the platform.

extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Observable at andreas-call.txt 5:12 (unprompted furnishing advice). 4-layer internal reinforcement.

extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Directly observable in the call (3:02-3:16 pricing format, 1:03-1:10 natural descriptions). Kahneman's bat-and-ball problem provides cognitive science validation. 3-layer reinforcement.

extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Mirrors Bryant's conversational structure throughout the call. 4-layer reinforcement as part of the System 1 trust cluster.

extensions.gap_filled: Process-before-promise trust architecture. No prior element specified the ordering of trust signals: mechanism first, claim second.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Grounded in Bryant's guarantee explanation (3:28-3:51) and Kahneman's causal chain/associative coherence. 3-layer reinforcement.

extensions.gap_filled: Conversational-density input patterns for listing creation. No prior element specified that core listing data should be capturable as fast as the host can say it in conversation.

extensions.gap_filled: Pre-packaged proposal presentation. No prior element specified that proposals should be presented as confirmations rather than constructions.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Mirrors Bryant's presentation of Ariel and Amber (1:58-2:19). 2-layer reinforcement.

extensions.gap_filled: Agent continuity frame across all platform communications. No prior element specified that the agent's identity should replace the brand as the primary communication entity.

extensions.gap_filled: Advisor prompt information architecture. No prior element specified the structure of the expertise solicitation moment.
extensions.confidence_note: Medium-high confidence. The pattern is well-grounded but the specific question wording will need user testing.

new_tokens_flagged.status: NOT in tokens.json. However, both surface (#ffffff) and shadow-md are in tokens.json separately. This is a composite token combining existing primitives.
new_tokens_flagged.recommendation: Add to tokens.json as a semantic token referencing existing primitives.

new_tokens_flagged.status: NOT in tokens.json. The token system has no font-size tokens at all.
new_tokens_flagged.recommendation: Add a font-size scale to tokens.json. 28px for primary financial figures is well-justified by the single-number focal point pattern.
Add alongside font-size-data-primary as part of a font-size scale.

new_tokens_flagged.status: NOT in tokens.json. The token system has no sizing tokens for components.
new_tokens_flagged.recommendation: Add as a component-size token. 40px for persistent header agent photos is well-justified.
Add alongside avatar-size-sm. 64px for featured onboarding agent photos is well-justified.
Add as a component-size token. The 24px value is derived from 12-13px mono text + xs (4px) vertical padding.

new_tokens_flagged.status: NOT in tokens.json. The token system has easing curves but no duration tokens.
new_tokens_flagged.recommendation: Add a duration scale to tokens.json. 0ms for acknowledgment, 350ms for settle, 500ms for celebrate.
Add alongside duration-acknowledge as part of a duration scale.

token_compliance.recommendation: 9 new tokens are proposed by Layer 3. All are well-justified by specific cognitive or behavioral requirements. None contradict existing tokens. The token system currently lacks font-size, component-size, and duration categories. These should be added as new categories in tokens.json. All proposed color values reference existing color tokens (no new colors are introduced). All proposed easing values reference existing easing tokens (out and spring). The token system is coherent; it simply needs to grow to accommodate the new categories that the design elements require.

journey_emotion_map.assessment: Single emotion target. Appropriate for a phase where the host encounters Split Lease for the first time. Calm = cognitive ease = System 1 approval. No conflict.

Three-emotion arc: calm (opening) -> relief (payment guarantee at 3:28-3:51) -> confidence (advisor shift at 5:12). This arc matches the observable emotional progression in the Andreas call. The sequence is additive: calm is the foundation, relief builds on calm, confidence builds on relief. No conflict.
Calm from cognitive ease, safety from agent continuity and associative warmth, momentum from forward-looking pacing. The arc is: calm -> safe -> moving forward. Coherent. No conflict.

Momentum from pacing, confidence from smart defaults and recognized expertise, the advisor glow from the expertise solicitation moment. The arc builds: momentum (early steps) -> confidence (defaults feel right) -> advisor glow (expertise recognized). Coherent. No conflict.

Relief from the number-then-mechanism sequence. Confidence from research-based defaults. The arc is: evaluation tension -> relief (numbers make sense) -> confidence (defaults are smart). Coherent. No conflict.

Confidence from the host's advisor identity (they evaluate proposals as experts). Relief from the financial terms confirming expectations. The arc is: expert evaluation -> financial confirmation -> confident endorsement. Coherent. No conflict.

Single emotion target. Safety from consistent warmth, guaranteed payments, and the persistent human thread. The host operates in System 2 low-effort mode. Only exceptions trigger System 2 engagement. Coherent. No conflict.

Safety from cumulative associative warmth. Curiosity from forward momentum (expanding portfolio, new opportunities). The arc is: safe (everything went well) -> curious (what is next?). Coherent. Only one source element (feels-005) directly addresses retention -- this is the thinnest emotional coverage. See coverage map.

emotional_arc_check.arc_assessment: The emotional arc across the full journey is coherent and progressive: calm -> relief -> confidence -> momentum -> safety -> curiosity. Each phase builds on the emotional foundation of the prior phase. No phase targets an emotion that contradicts a prior phase's target. The arc follows a natural investment trajectory: from cautious openness (discovery) through validated trust (evaluation/pricing) to active partnership (listing creation/proposals) to comfortable maintenance (active lease) to growth curiosity (retention). The only concern is retention's thin emotional coverage (single source element), which is addressed in coverage_map and loop_back_recommendations.

discovery.assessment: Discovery has elements from 4 of 5 layers but Layer 4 (interaction) is absent. This is partly appropriate -- discovery in the Andreas case is outbound outreach (a text message), not a platform interaction. However, if the platform supports inbound discovery (host finds Split Lease independently), interaction patterns for the landing experience are needed. The outbound discovery model (agent contacts host about specific property) is well-specified but the inbound model is a gap.

evaluation.assessment: Strong coverage at process and emotional layers. Layer 4 (interaction) is absent, which is appropriate because the evaluation phase is primarily a phone call, not a platform interaction. Layer 2 and Layer 3 each have only 1 element because the evaluation phase is human-mediated. Coverage is appropriate for the current model where evaluation = phone call.

onboarding.assessment: Excellent coverage across all 5 layers. Onboarding is the critical human-to-digital transition and receives the design attention it warrants. 15 elements provide comprehensive guidance.

listing_creation.assessment: Strongest coverage in the run: 18 elements across all 5 layers. Listing creation is the phase where the host does the most work on the platform, and the design stack provides comprehensive guidance. Every layer contributes 4-6 elements.

pricing.assessment: Strong coverage across all 5 layers. The single-sum financial pattern is deeply reinforced through communicates-002, looks-003, and feels-002. Pricing is well-served.

proposal_mgmt.assessment: Highest element count: 19 elements across all 5 layers. Layer 3 (visual) contributes all 7 of its elements to proposal management, reflecting its visual complexity. Comprehensive coverage.

active_lease.assessment: Thin coverage. 7 elements across 5 layers, but most layers contribute only 1-2 elements. This is partly appropriate: the active lease phase should require minimal platform interaction (System 2 low-effort mode). However, Layer 0 identified that the active lease phase has no observable evidence from the call (the call ends before any lease is signed). Future lenses that include active-lease host data should significantly strengthen this phase's coverage.

retention.assessment: Thinnest coverage: 5 elements. Each layer contributes exactly 1 element (except Layer 4 with 2). This is a known limitation of the current lens: the Andreas call is a first-contact conversation with zero retention data. The elements that do address retention (agent continuity, notifications, associative warmth) are reasonable extensions of earlier-phase principles but are not grounded in direct evidence. This is the phase most in need of a dedicated lens.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: Active lease and retention phases have thin coverage because the Andreas call ends before any lease is signed. Layer 0 notes this explicitly: 'This lens does not directly address the active lease phase' and 'This lens does not directly address retention.' The journey context for these phases is projected from earlier phases rather than directly evidenced.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: A second lens run using a returning host call (a host who has completed at least one lease cycle and is considering renewal) would fill the active lease and retention coverage gaps. Ideally, a call transcript where the host discusses their experience with the platform, payments, date changes, and their decision to renew or not renew.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: The production_tension_note at the end of Layer 3 identifies a significant gap: the current production code uses a purple-dominant palette and Inter/DM Sans fonts, while the design elements reference the taste model's warm neutrals with forest green and Instrument Serif/Outfit/IBM Plex Mono. This means the visual elements describe a TARGET state that does not yet exist in production.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: Layer 3 should produce a migration plan element that specifies how to transition from the current purple/Inter palette to the target warm/green/triad palette. This migration plan should be sequenced to maintain visual coherence during the transition rather than creating an abrupt switch.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: Layer 4 has zero elements covering the discovery and evaluation phases. While this is appropriate for the current model (discovery = outbound text, evaluation = phone call), the platform will need interaction patterns for inbound discovery (host finds Split Lease via search or referral) and digital evaluation (host evaluates Split Lease through the website without a phone call).
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: A future lens run should include a host who discovered Split Lease independently (not through agent outreach) and evaluated the platform without a phone call. This would fill the Layer 4 gaps for discovery and evaluation.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: The green accent color scope needs clarification. looks-005 reserves green exclusively for trust-verified elements, but the same layer and Layer 4 use green for primary action buttons (accept/confirm). This creates a semantic ambiguity where green sometimes means 'verified' and sometimes means 'click here.' The contradiction was identified above and needs resolution.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: A focused review of the accent color semantics: define explicitly which element types may use green, with distinct visual forms (badge pill vs. filled button) to preserve semantic clarity. Consider whether primary action buttons should be green (linking action to trust) or ink (#1a1714) (reserving green purely for verification).

loop_back_recommendations.reason: The tension between communicates-004 (dense single-screen input for unit snapshot) and behaves-002 (sequential one-cluster-at-a-time disclosure) needs explicit resolution through a scoped hybrid approach. The contradiction was identified above and a resolution was proposed, but neither layer currently specifies where density applies and where sequence applies.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: Both layers should include a scoping note: density (communicates-004 style) applies to recognition-heavy input steps where the host knows the data cold (unit snapshot, basic features). Sequential disclosure (behaves-002 style) applies to decision-heavy steps where the host faces unfamiliar choices (lease style, pricing, rules). The transition between modes should be explicit in the element specifications.

summary.coherence_verdict: HIGH. The run demonstrates exceptional internal coherence. 8 reinforcement clusters show that multiple layers independently converge on the same principles, with the human-to-digital trust transfer cluster achieving 6-layer convergence. The 3 contradictions found are low-to-medium severity and have clear resolution paths. The emotional arc is progressive and conflict-free. The primary limitation is lens-driven: the Andreas call provides rich evidence for discovery through listing creation but progressively thinner evidence for active lease and retention. This is not a design flaw but a data constraint that future lens runs can address.
